description: Number of 1's in binary expansion of Fibonacci(n).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
example: a(8) = 3 because Fibonacci(8) = 21, which in binary is 11001 and that has 3 on bits.a(9) = 2 because Fibonacci(9) = 34, which in binary is 100010 and that only has 2 on bits.
maple: A000120 := proc(n) add(d,d=convert(n,base,2)) ; end proc:A011373 := proc(n) A000120(combinat[fibonacci](n)) ; end proc:seq(A011373(n),n=0..50) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 22 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
